title.narrative: INTEGRATED IMMUNIZATION SERVICES

description.narrative: Health facilities in intervention areas, including urban areas and humanitarian situation, have increased capacity to provide equitable, quality and integrated immunization services., which contributes to Evaluation, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care (Covid), Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Women and children, including the marginalized and those living in humanitarian situations, have access to and use high-impact health and HIV interventions from pregnancy to adolescence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Health facilities in intervention areas, including urban areas and humanitarian situation, have increased capacity to provideequitable, quality and integrated immunization services.

description.narrative: UNICEF a contribué au maintien du statut "0 cas de poliomyélite sauvage “et à l&39;élimination du tétanos maternel et néonatal à travers le renforcement des piliers de la vaccination de routine. 86% des districts sanitaires ont une couverture vaccinale Penta 3 au-dessus de 80%, un score de gestion efficace des vaccins à 83%, 5 des 8 régions ont un comité de coordination interagence fonctionnels, 37,5% des districts disposent de plan d’action basé sur l’équité. 4,408,426 enfants vaccinés avec le nOPV2. Le pays s’est doté d’un plan national de déploiement du vaccin contre la COVID-19 avec le soutien de l’UNICEF. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/12/2021
